title: Make individual prompt parts toggleable

labels.name: ✅ existing workaround
labels.description: When there is an unofficial way to solve an issue and there is no fix in starship yet.

body:
## Feature Request

#### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I find myself quite often toggling on and off individual parts of the prompt, depending on what I am currently doing. For example when I am working with kubernetes, I have the kubernetes prompt activated, but since it's quite long I usually de-activate it for all other work.

#### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. Add any considered drawbacks. -->
I'd love to have a simple toggle command, that allows you to activate and deactivate parts of the prompt on demand.

This of course could be done in a variety of ways, the most simple one I came up with was to have a `toggle` command that takes in a "prompt part":
```
starship toggle <prompt>
```
\<prompt\> would be any of https://starship.rs/config/#prompt

so to toggle kubernetes it could be:
```
starship toggle kubernetes
```

In this idea, starship would determine behind the scenes if the current prompt part is activated or deactivated, choose the corresponding toggle action, and automatically "reload" the prompt.

#### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. -->
Currently I simply change it in the `starship.toml` and re-run `starship init`.
